findings.title: Approval racing condition
findings.description: The standard ERC20 implementation contains a widely-known racing condition in its approve function, wherein a spender is able to witness the token owner broadcast a transaction altering their approval, and quickly sign and broadcast a transaction using transferFrom to move the current approved amount from the owner's balance to the spender.

findings.title: VoteForCandidate() doesn't check if correlationID is correct or not
findings.description: The VoteForCandidate function does not verify the correctness of the correlationID, allowing voters to participate with an incorrect ID and resulting in wasted votes and tokens.

findings.title: Pausable Contract is not imported anywhere as well as not used
findings.description: The Pausable contract is declared but not utilized or imported anywhere in the code.

findings.title: Incorrect token deduction when creating ballot
findings.description: When creating a ballot, using 'prices[uint(Types.Service.CREATE_BALLOT)] = 5000000;' will only deduct 5000000/10**18 tokens instead of 5 ZUZ tokens.

findings.title: Incorrect token deduction when voting for a candidate
findings.description: When voting for a candidate, using 1000000 will only deduct 1000000/10**18 and not 1 ZUZ tokens.

findings.title: Solidity version is not yet fixed
findings.description: The Solidity version used in the contract is not fixed, which can lead to potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Unused Variable 'balloutId' in Main Contract
findings.description: The variable 'balloutId' is declared but never used in the main contract, which can lead to unnecessary gas consumption and potential security risks.

findings.title: Contract Pausable Never Used
findings.description: The contract Pausable is never used and can be removed.

findings.title: Emit is not used while emitting event in all the cases
findings.description: The finding suggests that the emit keyword is not consistently used when emitting events within the smart contract.
